message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes a method for query-by-example speech search using acoustic word embeddings learned through a deep convolutional neural network. This involves processing spoken word pairs with their original temporal context to form fixed-length speech segment pairs. The paper also discusses the importance of having sufficient speech segment pairs to train the deep CNN for effective acoustic word embeddings. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. Other likely sub-categories include cs.SD (Sound), cs.SI (Signal Processing), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which are all relevant to the paper's focus on speech processing and deep learning.
